title: EVCIM
text: We started by recovering recycled metal from abandoned mattresses. The springs were heated to straighten them and then cut using a plier. This metal was mixed with concrete to create our homemade weight plates.

title: EVCIM
text: We started by recovering recycled metal from abandoned mattresses. The springs were heated to straighten them and then cut using a plier. This metal was mixed with concrete to create our homemade weight plates.

title: EVCIM
text:
Painting the Weights
  

Once the concrete dried, the plates were coated in matte black paint. At this stage, we finalized the 5kg weight plate design. However, we could only produce six at a time.

title: EVCIM
text:
Our Finished Product
  

The result: clean, consistent 5kg concrete weights reinforced with metal. A major milestone, but we weren‚Äôt done yet.

title: EVCIM
text:
Experimenting with Moulds
  

To scale up, we began developing a more consistent mould using recycled plastics. The aim was to perfect a system that would always produce identical weights at a more frequent rate.

title: EVCIM
text:
Drying Rack Innovation
  

We repurposed discarded wooden planks to build a drying rack. This allowed us to cure multiple weights simultaneously and improve our workflow.

title: EVCIM
text:
Behind the Process

  Your browser does not support the video tag. 

This clip shows part of our early-stage process: heating and bending metal taken from mattress springs ‚Äî a key reinforcement element in the final weight.

title: EVCIM
text:
Transport Tactics
  

You might be wondering how we brought the mattresses home‚Ä¶ This is how. Do not try this at home ‚Äî unless you‚Äôre feeling lucky and you have a very good excuse to the guards.

title: EVCIM
text:
Reflection

At the core of the EVCIM project is a belief that fitness should be accessible to everyone. Gym equipment, especially weights, can be expensive ‚Äî but through recycling, creativity, and sheer trial-and-error, we‚Äôve managed to design affordable, functional weights from materials that would‚Äôve ended up in landfills.


We‚Äôre not just making plates ‚Äî we‚Äôre building a movement where passion meets sustainability. And we‚Äôre not stopping until everyone can train, lift, and grow without breaking the bank.If you want to check out our instgarm click on the icon below.

title: Academic projects
text:
For this project, my team and I conducted a strategic analysis of Dairy Gold. We examined their current market position, supply chain efficiency, and brand value. Based on our findings, we provided actionable recommendations to improve their overall strategy in a highly competitive market.

title: Academic projects

Vietnamese Coffee Supply Chain Production
  

We analyzed the supply chain production of Vietnamese coffee‚Äîevaluating sourcing, production costs, and sustainability. We provided strategic recommendations to enhance efficiency, quality, and environmental responsibility.

title: Academic projects
text:
Vietnamese Sim
  

This project involved developing a simulation model for Vietnamese coffee‚Äêsupply‚Äêchain management. I used Python (in Spyder) to run simulation tests and examine how different events‚Äîsuch as prolonged monsoons‚Äîcould affect production.
Click On The Image To Read The Report!

title: Academic projects
text:
WaterWize ‚Äì Water Testing Device
  

WaterWize‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääour NED project‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääturns slow water testing into instant checks. Our pocket-sized device spots Legionella in seconds and beams results to your phone. Think of it as a Fitbit for your water system‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääalways on, always watching.
Click On The Image To Read The Full Report!

title: About Me
text:
My Business Hustle ‚Äì EVCIM

I handled everything from door-to-door sales to backend logic and automation systems ‚Äî learning how lean businesses truly run.

title: About Me

Real-World Work Experience


For 4+ years, I‚Äôve worked at Golden Grill, a family-run restaurant in Carlow.
There I manage tills, assist with stock, and even jump into the kitchen at times.


It‚Äôs taught me the importance of customer service, teamwork, and community engagement ‚Äî things no textbook can teach.

title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Since I can remember, I‚Äôve always loved cricket ‚Äî it‚Äôs been a way of life for me. It allowed me to express myself, stay active, and build lifelong friendships. Every summer as a kid, whether in Ireland or visiting Pakistan, I‚Äôd spend hours playing cricket, often with family and friends.
Cricket was never just a game ‚Äî it was a dream. But dreams require hard work. Over the past year, I‚Äôve taken that seriously: analyzing my technique, reviewing my match performances, and breaking down what I need to improve ‚Äî both mentally and physically.

title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Performance Metrics & Stats
Over the last two seasons, I‚Äôve played for Carlow (2023) and then moved to North County (2024). I moved to experience a higher level of cricket. Here are some stats and breakdowns of my performance ‚Äî from batting scores to wicket-taking form.


North County (2024‚Äì2024)









Carlow (2023)







The move from Carlow to North County was a much-needed change. North County‚Äôs ground (The Inch) provided a far better playing environment, and I got the opportunity to compete at a higher level ‚Äî going from Division 16 in Carlow to regularly playing Division 4 at North County.
This 12-division jump in just one year reflects the hard work and dedication I‚Äôve put in, and it continues to motivate me. My total runs increased from 267 in 2023 to 567 in 2024, and my average also improved significantly ‚Äî all while playing at a higher level.
The pie charts played a huge role in helping me understand how I was getting out. For example, frequent LBWs helped me realize that my head was falling across the stumps, making me unbalanced. By identifying these patterns, I was able to make technical corrections and improve my consistency.
I still have a long way to go, but the data has given me the clarity and confidence that I‚Äôm moving in the right direction.

title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Reflection
Each year of cricket has taught me something new. I‚Äôve used coding to visualize performance trends and stats, helping me identify weaknesses and build confidence. This is just the beginning of my journey.
Stay tuned ‚Äî this is only the start.
